basics.name: David England
basics.label: Available for Hire
basics.summary: Very versatile worker with extensive experience in many diverse areas. Able to adapt to almost any work environment. Especially enjoy working with data, programming and statistics.

highlights: Various LEAN manufacturing assembly line positions
End of the line testing and evaluation.

work.summary: Taught Learning Support Math, Developmental Studies, Algebra, and Statistics.

highlights: Integrating IDX MLS into [Real Estate Intellicence Agency](http://www.RealEstate-Huntsville.com)
Integrating IDX MLS into [Cherokee Ridge Home](http://CherokeeRidgeHomes.com)
Webmaster: PHP, Javascript, jQuery, and plugins.

work.summary: Worked in the construction, shipping and setup of IHSN franchises for the manufacture of Structurally Insulated Panels (SIPs).Also built and assembled houses from SIPs.

highlights: Trouble shot computers and resolved network issues.

work.summary: Investigated the loss of high frequency radio transmissions due to weather events.
Extracted climate data from NASA and NOAA databases to improve climate models.
Worked at Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA) simulating ozone transport. Continued development of Atmospheric simulations. Wrote papers and proposals.

work.company: The University of Alabama in Huntsville
work.summary: Taught Calculus and Differential Equations. Continued research and development of atmospheric numerical models. Wrote papers and proposals.
Analyzed and Designed an experiment to determine the near-miss distance for the Anti-Satellite (ASAT) project. Provided intelligence support for the First Gulf War.

education.area: Math, Statistics and the Atmospheric Sciences
education.summary: Dissertation: A Mathematical Analysis of Nocturnal Slope Flows.

education.area: Math, Statistics and the Atmospheric Sciences
education.summary: Calibrated pyronometers for NASA. Launched weather balloons. Researched and developed numerical weather and climate models. Taught Pre-Calculus thru Differential Equations level courses.

education.area: Math, Computer Science, Statistics and Physics
education.summary: Also showed films at media center and worked in the computer lab.

publications.name: Predictability of the Stable Atmospheric Boundary Layer
Stability Functions based upon Shear Functions
On the Behavior of the Stable Boundary Layer and the Role of Initial Conditions
Concerning the Limiting Behavior of Time-dependent Slope Winds
publications.publisher: Journal of the Atmospheric Sciences/American Meteorological Society

references.name: Mikko Jetsu
references.reference: I have used David for Web and IT technology services for my companies over the years. He was assisting me in early 90's to hand code html for websites - at a time companies were still trying to justify value for building a website. Today he provides advice and support for all IT related challenges my company faces. I admire his ability to keep up with technological change and see the relevance to my business.

references.name: Tammy Borren
references.reference: Dr. England is a part-time instructor of mathematics at our Clifton campus. He is good with the students, and willing to be flexible with scheduling. If he says he will teach a class, then I don't have any worries about that class for the semester.

references.name: Derrick T. Copeland
references.reference: Dave is hands down brilliant. His perspective and point of view along with his dedication to problem solving were vital to the completion of our advanced research project. I hope we have the opportunity to work together again.

references.name: Justin Hnilo
references.reference: I have known David England for 20 years and know him to be an exceptional scientist. His adherence to detail and want to dive into deep problems and work out a solution is something one rarely comes across in the applied sciences. His comprehensive knowledge covers a broad area that of, applied mathematics, physics and mathematical modeling. Though not only a brilliant scientist, one who is always willing to lend a helping hand. I would like to give my strongest recommendation to David England.
